process.util

Class FileUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • process.util.FileUtility

  • public class FileUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of methods used to manage files
    Author:
    Aldric Vitali Silvestre

    • Method Detail

      • fileExists

        public static boolean fileExists(java.lang.String filename)
        Checks if a file with the same name is on the computer
        Parameters:
        filename - the file (with path) of the file
        Returns:
        if the file actually exists or not

      • searchFileOutputName

        public static java.lang.String searchFileOutputName(java.lang.String filename)
        Create a new file name depending on the presence (or not) of another files that have the same name.
        Parameters:
        filename - the path of the file to check
        Returns:
        the same String, or a string like "file(1).ext" if file like "file.ext" already exists

      • getFilenameExtension

        public static java.lang.String getFilenameExtension(java.lang.String filename)
        Get the extension from the filename provided
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file
        Returns:
        the extension without the '.' if extsts, an empty String else

      • getRightFilenameExtension

        public static java.lang.String getRightFilenameExtension(java.lang.String filename,
                                                         java.lang.String extension)
        Set the filename so that the extension is the one desired.

        ex :

        • changeFilenameExtension("file.txt", "jpg") == "file.jpg"
        • changeFilenameExtension("file", "jpg") == "file.jpg"

      • isFileWithGoodExtension

        public static boolean isFileWithGoodExtension(java.lang.String filename,
                                              java.lang.String extension)

        public static long getNumberOfLines(java.io.File file)

                                              java.io.File file2)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Check if two files have the exact same content
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
